Comparison of unemployment rates: The expert compared the unemployment rate in New Jersey when Governor Chris Christie took office to the current unemployment rate to verify the claim that it is significantly lower.
Analysis of the number of unemployed ind: The expert examined the number of unemployed individuals in New Jersey before and after Governor Christie's tenure to determine if there was a significant decrease, as stated in the claim.
Evaluation of statistical significance: The expert assessed whether the changes in unemployment rate and number of unemployed individuals were statistically significant, considering the standard criteria for determining statistical significance.
Examination of private: sector job growth: The expert analyzed the data on private-sector job growth during Governor Christie's tenure to verify the claim of creating 50,000 new private sector jobs in the last 20 months.
